item.title: Basic Linear Algebra
item.description: Week 1 For any vector: $$ \overrightarrow{AB}=\overrightarrow{OB}-\overrightarrow{OA} $$ Can be denoted as: $$ \left[ \begin{matrix} b_1 - a_1 \\\ b_2 - a_2 \end{matrix} \right] or \left[ \begin{matrix} b_1 - a_1 , b_2 - a_2 \end{matrix} \right] $$ $\overrightarrow{OA}$ is the position vector of A. $\overrightarrow{AB}$ is the displacement vector from A to B.
